file_content.text: Maybe I'll be shipped back to Dromund Kaas to recuperate. Here's hoping, eh?
Take my advice, don't wash out that Gormak blood. Makes you all match.
Take my advice, don't wash out that Gormak blood. Suits you.
So, Raklann's finally vorantikus bait. I can't think of anyone who deserved it more.
Raklann was a fool who paid the price for challenging us.
He brought it on himself.
Amusing that Raklann worked so hard for such an ignominious death.
We get what we earn.
You're making me wish I'd been there.
The Empire's always gonna have people making trouble. Just remember who to call.
If you do, I'll handle them.
When they hear Raklann's taken care of, the Voss might want to discuss alliances again.
This will please the Voss.
Not my department, but good to know.
There should be no danger of a guerrilla war erupting, now that Raklann's gone.
Voss should be secure.
He was hardly a challenge.
The Gormak are in disarray, the Voss are safe... Darth Serevin's happier than a Gamorrean in a mud bath.
Oh, that's right. Darth Serevin said he has a gift for you. It's with Lesi Garahe, his aide in Voss-Ka. Must be something worth having.
If Darth Serevin is feeling generous, who am I to say "no"?
Here's hoping.
Get well soon, Major.
Absolutely. When we finish off the Republic, I want to be there.
I should go.
It's been an honor, my lord. Good hunting.
It's been a pleasure. Maybe I'll see you on the battlefield someday.
You did it! Our troops have Raklann pinned down--he's all yours!
Lieutenant Kadriss and Sergeant Jaymis are the men you need. I'll be waiting here to signal our forces.
You're a sight for sore eyes, my lord. I hope you're here to purge this place.
At last, some friendly faces. Get me out of this place, will you?
Finally. Someone who'll understand. Get me out of here, will you?
Blasted Republic troops everywhere. If I was well, I'd--ugh! Those scum won't help me get a proper Imperial doctor, you know. Or even a pretty nurse.
The Republic's endless rhetoric about "compassion and understanding" crumbles so easily.
So typical of the Republic.
I'm just grateful they haven't--ugh! Haven't shipped me off to Coruscant in the dead of night.
I'm not really an expert, but I could probably bend you back into shape.
I could treat you. Sort of.
Very... very gracious, my lord. But I, uh, won't trouble you.
Next you'll be asking for a cup of hot milk and a story.
Toughen up, will you?
Hey, in recruiting, they--ugh! They promise proper care if you're wounded.
You can never be sure what a Republic medic's injecting you with.
You're right to be careful.
It looks like the Republic forces have made themselves at home.
Why is the Republic here?
It's a Voss outpost. Like Voss-Ka--everyone's welcome. With plenty of commandos to keep us all best friends.
Does it matter who's holding the kolto, if it gets you back on your feet?
Just let them treat you.
With respect, my lord, would you take the risk?
No offense, but--you first.
Lord Pallas said someone would come about Raklann--that Gormak swine. Never thought anyone would order an attack on a Mystic.
Those Gormak killed her and my men, then started going through our datapads. They seemed interested in any information about the Shrine of Healing.
You think Raklann's planning to attack the shrine.
That's Raklann's real target.
First Mystics, now the shrine.
If these Gormak killed all your men and a Mystic, how did you survive?
Why weren't you killed, too?
I played dead; when the vorantiki trampled me, even I started believing it.
If Raklann's after the shrine, that makes the local Gormak forces Raklann's rear guard--meaning, we've got him.
Hitting his rear guard will break through that alliance of tribes he's made. The Gormak will scatter. Then Raklann's ripe for the plucking.
If Raklann gets away, he could raise another army. We'd be back where we started.
We need to cut off his escape.
Darth Serevin's sending additional troops. They'll cut Raklann off and leave him stranded.
Your service to the Empire will be noted.
You have done well, Major.
I'd trade it to be back on the front lines, my lord.
Nice plan. Seems like you've given this plenty of thought.
Good thinking, Major.
Not much else to do while my bones knit.
So long as there's killing.
You'll have all the Gormak you can handle.
The Voss want Raklann finished, too--Sergeant Jaymis reported a Voss civilian who was talking about Gormak movements.
And a Mystic had some intel for us: I told Lieutenant Kadriss to look into it. That could be the key to breaking Raklann's rear guard.
I'm guessing you won't just be resting quietly through all this.
And what will you be doing?
I'll see it done.
If not, the shrine may fall.
I'll be here coordinating our men. When you've hit the rear guard, I'll have our forces cut off Raklann's retreat.
These coordinates will be Raklann's only possible bolt-hole. Follow him there, and make it his grave.
Can't someone at least get me a decent drink?
